headline: Intel Stock Gets an AI Upgrade. Why This Analyst Is Optimistic.
summary: The AI trade faces doubts about whether it can last another year, but artificial intelligence also has its share of believers on Wall Street.  Shares of Intel and Marvell Technology could be winners.  One is Ben Reitzes, an analyst at Melius Research, who upgraded  Marvell Technology  and  Intel  to Buy from Hold and assigning price targets to both stocks.

headline: Marvell and Intel Stocks Are AI Buys, Says Analyst
summary: The AI trade faces doubts about whether it can last another year, but artificial intelligence also has its share of believers on Wall Street.  One is Ben Reitzes, an analyst at Melius Research, who upgraded  Marvell Technology  and  Intel  to Buy from Hold and assigning price targets to both stocks.  Marvell  came in at $135, and Intel at $50.

headline: Dow Surges to Record High, Touching 49,000 for First Time
summary: The Dow on Monday surged north of 49,000 for the first time.  The blue-chip index rallied 651 points, or 1.4%.  Following the U.S.'s capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, Wall Street was favoring consumer discretionary, financials, energy, industrials, communication services, and materials.

headline: Jefferies downgrades Adobe, upgrades IBM as AI reshapes 2026 software outlook
summary: Investing.com -- Jefferies has shifted its software recommendations for 2026, downgrading Adobe to Hold while upgrading IBM to Buy, as analysts warn that investors may “need to stay patient” for meaningful AI-driven revenue acceleration.

headline: Turnium Appoints Industry Veteran as VP of Global Strategy and Partnerships to Accelerate International Growth
summary: Vancouver, British Columbia--(Newsfile Corp. - January 5, 2026) - Turnium Technology Group Inc. (TSXV: TTGI) (FSE: E48) ("Turnium" or the "Company"), a global leader in Technology-as-a-Service (TaaS) and partner enablement services, is pleased to announce the appointment of Aldo G. Gallone as Vice President of Global Strategy and Partnerships. Mr. Gallone brings over 35 years of leadership experience in the technology sector, with a proven track record of scaling sales organizations, developing.

headline: How DLocal’s More Independent Board and New Committees Could Impact DLocal (DLO) Investors
summary: DLocal has completed its transition to a nine-person, majority independent Board of Directors, adding former Citi executive Paco Ybarra and ex-Google and IBM leader Nelson Mattos, while also forming new governance, compensation, and product and technology committees. The shift of co-founder Sergio Fogel into a non-executive strategic advisory role signals a clearer separation between management and oversight, potentially reshaping how DLocal balances growth initiatives with risk...
